review_title: Supportive environment, career progression, excellent benefits
pros: Career progression opportunities: The Institute's commitment to employee growth has been clear since I joined and I have advanced in my role and capabilities during my time here. My manager has been instrumental in guiding and mentoring me along the way, providing valuable feedback and insights. Learning and Development: There is a particular emphasis on learning and development relevant to the business and personal growth and is currently supporting me with studying for a professional qualification alongside other development opportunities. Benefits package is excellent: Includes a generous holiday entitlement that rises with service with additional days off at Christmas, health and life insurance, paid volunteering days, EAP, company sick pay and high street discounts. The Institute's culture values work flexibility and autonomy, we all work from home but collaborate together and have regular team-building activities. There is an open-door policy and commitment to inclusive policies and early resolution and I feel genuinely supported by management and colleagues.
cons: Provides great opportunities for dynamic individuals who are committed to progressing the Institute but may not suit those seeking a relaxed work pace.

review_title: Extensive training and opportunities for growth and career development
job_title: Senior Business Manager in Atherstone, England
pros: Extensive training and development - the organisation sponsored me to complete my Level 7 Senior Leaders apprenticeship and MBA, I was also able to complete my Agile Project Management Foundation accreditation and have also undertaken facilitated conversations training and Dynamics 365 training. There is a dedicated L&D budget per head which we are able to take advantage of, plus access to our online e-learning platform MyLeadership and careers platform. Everyone in the organisation also goes through our Leadership Development Programme which is facilitated by the CEO. We have extensive workplace benefits, including access to private healthcare, competitive pension, up to 30 holiday days and additional days off at Christmas. I work remotely and have full autonomy over my work-life balance and my workload. The culture at The Institute means that you can take an idea and run with it, exploring the ramifications without being beholden to the constraints of a more traditional, hierarchical organisation. Our focus on agility means that the pace can be fast, but we also have freedom to fail. We also do an astounding amount of work to support our culture, including an internal net promoter score and resolution focused policies. More importantly, I feel able to be honest with the Senior Leadership Team and CEO, without fear of reprisal or negativity. We aren't perfect, but I genuinely believe that my colleagues are passionate about the work that they do, have good intentions and deeply care for the organisation. We have ambitious plans for growth and I am excited to see where the next few years take us.
cons: We currently struggle with a brand identity issue with the ILM, which can cause confusion, however we are building a distinct identity of our own.

review_title: Very supportive, great role models, learning & development encouraged
pros: Very supportive managers and colleagues Approachable CEO Great role models Learning & development encouraged Fantastic benefits

Flexible working, home based roles. Encouraged to improve and develop. Opportunities to progress internally, always look to promote from within. Excellent holidays, closed over Xmas with no need to book holiday, 25 days a year with an extra day for every year worked (max 30) plus Bank Holidays too.
